Posts.Content: blessed12 wrote: I was called back for a second mammogram and ultra sound due to 4 mm new mass in my right breast (requires additional evaluation).  In call back, they could see the mass in only one mammogram (spot compression) but not the other projection.  Both the tech and the radiologist could not find anything on the ultra sound.  I am 45 with breast cancer in my family.  Recommendation from call back was to come back in 3 months for mammogram and ultra sound. The findings on my original mammo report are:  Finding 1 - Intramammary lymph nodes are in both breast are benign-negative.  Finding 2 - New mass in the right breast requires additional evaluation.  Additional projections are recommended.  Spot compression is recommended.  An ultrasound exam of the right breast is recommended. Of course, ever since I was called I have been so worried.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Second Mammogram and ultra sound blessed12 blessed12

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2013 08:51AM blessed12 wrote: Thank you for your caring response edwards750.  I am trying so hard to stay busy and think positive.  I just worry by nature.  The radiologist was super and at first he said come back in 6 months but based on my concerns...he said 3 months.  I have read so much on the internet that does add to my worrying at times.  I just know it is up to me to take my health in my own hands so I question and read about everything.  Should I change what I am doing...instead of going to my drs. for a mammo...go to a speciality center that is considered breast screening experts.  For future "annual" screenings, should I ask for more.  So many questions going through my head.  Just scared.
Posts.Title: Second Mammogram and ultra sound blessed12 blessed12
